Package FBLAQuiz

Class ScoreReport

java.lang.Object
FBLAQuiz.ScoreReport
public class ScoreReport
extends java.lang.Object

Score Report Class

The Score Report Class creates a score report for a Quiz object, which is essentially a collection of questionReports for each of the Quiz's questions. This class records and writes each quiz's data to a database, along with implementing methods to display a report for the Quiz. A ScoreReport object is meant to be created only upon the completion of a Quiz.
Author:
Varun Unnithan

    A custom JLabel whose alpha level (opacity) can be changed, so as to allow for animations such as fading in
    class  ScoreReport.ScorePanel
    A custom JPanel made specifically for displaying a ScoreReport's details

    The amount of time taken on the quiz, measured from its start to its submission, in seconds.
    private int score
    An value between 0 and 5 that represents the number of questions answered correctly in the Quiz

    • ScoreReport

      public ScoreReport​(Quiz quiz)
      Creates a ScoreReport object to represent the results of a given Quiz
      Parameters:

    • ScoreReport

      public ScoreReport​(org.json.simple.JSONObject DBscoreReport)
      Creates a ScoreReport object from a given JSONObject. The passed JSONObject should be a member of the JSONArray that makes up the scoreReport database.
      Parameters:
      DBscoreReport - The JSONObject for which to create a report.

    • get12hrTime

      public static java.lang.String get12hrTime​(java.lang.String dateAndTime)
      Formats a given date and time into a 12-hour clock format
      Parameters:
      dateAndTime - The String for the date and time, written in RFC-1123 date and time format
      Returns:
      The formatted String, with the date cut out, in the format of time + PM/AM

    • updateDB

      public void updateDB() throws java.io.IOException
      Updates the score report JSON database with this score report by adding it
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - On input error or error when writing the desired files

    • createPDF

      public void createPDF​(java.lang.String pdfName) throws java.io.IOException
      Creates and saves a printable PDF file from this score report

      pdfName - The name of the PDF file to be created
      Throws:

    • wrapText

      private int wrapText​(org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.PDPageContentStream contentStream, java.lang.String text, org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDFont pdfFont, float fontSize, float wrapWidth) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes text onto a PDF from a content stream with the text wrapped around the edgs of the page
      Parameters:
      contentStream - The PDPageContentStream from which to write through
      text - The text that is to be written and wrapped
      pdfFont - The font for the text that is to be wrapped
      fontSize - The font size for the text
      wrapWidth - The width of the bounding box by which the text will be wrapped
      Returns:
      The number of lines the text has been formatted into
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - On error when writing to the stream

    • createPanel

      public javax.swing.JPanel createPanel​(int delay, java.awt.Dimension panelSize, java.awt.event.ActionListener exitAction, java.lang.String exitMessage)
      Creates a JPanel to display a ScoreReport's contents
      Parameters:
      delay - The amount of milliseconds to wait before displaying this panel
      panelSize - The size of the parent panel or frame
      exitAction - The Action to be taken upon the clicking of the exit button
      Returns:
      the JPanel The JPanel that is created that displays this score report
